help: Usage: # alignment help # just for alignment help [COMMAND] Options:
h: Usage: # alignment help # just for alignment help [COMMAND] Options:
trace: Usage: # alignment trace # just for alignment trace [0 | 1] t [0 | 1] Options:
t: Usage: # alignment trace # just for alignment trace [0 | 1] t [0 | 1] Options:
verbose: Usage: # alignment verbose # just for alignment verbose [LEVEL] v [LEVEL] Options:
v: Usage: # alignment verbose # just for alignment verbose [LEVEL] v [LEVEL] Options:
ls: Usage: # alignment ls # just for alignment ls [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size
tree: Usage: # alignment tree # just for alignment tree [OPTION]... [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -d, --depth maximum display depth of tree -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size
cd: Usage: # alignment cd # just for alignment cd [DIR] Options:
mkdir: Usage: # alignment mkdir # just for alignment mkdir DIR Options:
cp: Usage: # alignment cp # just for alignment cp SOURCE DEST cp SOURCE... DIR Options:
mv: Usage: # alignment mv # just for alignment mv SOURCE DEST mv SOURCE... DIR Options:
rm: Usage: # alignment rm # just for alignment rm [FILE]... Options:
exec: Usage: # alignment exec # just for alignment exec COMMAND : COMMAND : COMMAND Options:
:: Usage: # alignment exec # just for alignment exec COMMAND : COMMAND : COMMAND Options:
rls: Usage: # alignment rls # just for alignment rls [OPTION]... [DIR] rls [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size
rtree: Usage: # alignment rtree # just for alignment rtree [OPTION]... [DIR] rtree [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [DIR] Options: # alignment -a, --all show hidden files too -d, --depth maximum display depth of tree -g, --group group by file type -l show more details -r, --reverse reverse sort order -S show files size -s, --sort-size sort by size
rcd: Usage: # alignment rcd # just for alignment rcd [DIR] Options:
rmkdir: Usage: # alignment rmkdir # just for alignment rmkdir DIR rmkdir [SHARING_LOCATION] DIR Options:
rcp: Usage: # alignment rcp # just for alignment rcp SOURCE DEST rcp SOURCE... DIR rcp [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE DEST rcp [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE... DIR Options:
rmv: Usage: # alignment rmv # just for alignment rmv SOURCE DEST rmv SOURCE... DIR rmv [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE DEST rmv [SHARING_LOCATION] SOURCE... DIR Options:
rrm: Usage: # alignment rrm # just for alignment rrm [FILE]... rrm [SHARING_LOCATION] [FILE]... Options:
rexec: Usage: # alignment rexec # just for alignment rexec COMMAND :: COMMAND ::COMMAND rexec [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND :: [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND ::[SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND Options:
::: Usage: # alignment rexec # just for alignment rexec COMMAND :: COMMAND ::COMMAND rexec [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND :: [SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND ::[SERVER_LOCATION] COMMAND Options:
scan: Usage: # alignment scan # just for alignment scan [OPTION]... s [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -L show more details of both servers and sharings -l show more details of sharings
s: Usage: # alignment scan # just for alignment scan [OPTION]... s [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -L show more details of both servers and sharings -l show more details of sharings
connect: Usage: # alignment connect # just for alignment connect SERVER_LOCATION Options:
open: Usage: # alignment open # just for alignment open SHARING_LOCATION o SHARING_LOCATION Options:
o: Usage: # alignment open # just for alignment open SHARING_LOCATION o SHARING_LOCATION Options:
get: Usage: # alignment get # just for alignment get [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... get [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -N, --newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --no never overwrite files -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -y, --yes always overwrite files
g: Usage: # alignment get # just for alignment get [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [REMOTE_FILE]... get [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... g [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [REMOTE_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -N, --newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --no never overwrite files -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -y, --yes always overwrite files
put: Usage: # alignment put # just for alignment put [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... put [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -N, --newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --no never overwrite files -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -y, --yes always overwrite files
p: Usage: # alignment put # just for alignment put [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [LOCAL_FILE]... put [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... p [OPTION]... [SHARING_LOCATION] [LOCAL_FILE]... Options: # alignment -c, --check performs a check of files consistency -N, --newer overwrite files only if newer -n, --no never overwrite files -q, --quiet doesn't show progress -y, --yes always overwrite files
list: Usage: # alignment list # just for alignment list [OPTION]... list [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
info: Usage: # alignment info # just for alignment info [OPTION]... i [OPTION]... info [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... i [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
i: Usage: # alignment info # just for alignment info [OPTION]... i [OPTION]... info [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... i [SERVER_LOCATION] [OPTION]... Options: # alignment -l show more details of sharings
ping: Usage: # alignment ping # just for alignment ping [OPTION]... ping [OPTION]... [SERVER_LOCATION] Options: # alignment -c, --count stop after count messages
es: Usage: # alignment es # just for alignment es [OPTION]... [COMMAND [COMMAND_ARGUMENTS]] Options: # alignment -d, --discover-port port used for broadcast discovery messages -h, --help show this help --no-color don't print ANSI escape characters -t, --trace <0_or_1> enable/disable tracing -v, --verbose set verbosity level -V, --version show the easyshare version -w, --discover-wait time to wait for discovery responses # alignment SEE THE MAN PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND EXAMPLES
esd:
Usage: # alignment esd # just for alignment esd [OPTION]... [SHARING [SHARING_NAME] [SHARING_OPTION]...] Options: # alignment -a, --address
server address (default is primary interface) -c, --config load settings from a esd configuration file -d, --discover-port port used to listen to discovery messages (default is 12021) -e, --rexec enable rexec (remote execution) -h, --help show this help -n, --name server name --no-color don't print ANSI escape characters -P, --password server password, plain or hashed with es-tools -p, --port server port (default is 12020) --ssl-cert path to an SSL certificate --ssl-privkey path to an SSL private key -t, --trace <0_or_1> enable/disable tracing -v, --verbose set verbosity level -V, --version show the easyshare version # alignment SEE THE MAN PAGE FOR MORE INFO AND EXAMPLES
usage: Type es --help for see es usage and options. Type help command for the full documentation of a command. Available commands are: General commands help show this help exit, quit, q exit from the interactive shell trace, t enable/disable packet tracing verbose, v change verbosity level Connection establishment commands scan, s scan the network for easyshare servers connect connect to a remote server disconnect disconnect from a remote server open, o open a remote sharing (eventually discovering it) close, c close the remote sharing Transfer commands get, g get files and directories from the remote sharing put, p put files and directories in the remote sharing Local commands pwd show the name of current local working directory ls list local directory content l alias for ls -la tree list local directory contents in a tree-like format cd change local working directory mkdir create a local directory cp copy files and directories locally mv move files and directories locally rm remove files and directories locally exec, : execute an arbitrary command locally Remote commands rpwd show the name of current remote working directory rls list remote directory content rl alias for rls -la rtree list remote directory contents in a tree-like format rcd change remote working directory rmkdir create a remote directory rcp copy files and directories remotely rmv move files and directories remotely rrm remove files and directories remotely rexec, :: execute an arbitrary command remotely (disabled by default) since it will compromise server security Server information commands info, i show information about the remote server list list the sharings of the remote server ping test the connection with the remote server
